thread.title: BRIT Awards 2017: The 1975 performance 'HACKED'? Stunt sees insults flash up on screen
thread.title_full: BRIT Awards 2017: The 1975 performance 'HACKED'? Stunt sees insults flash up on screen

title: BRIT Awards 2017: The 1975 performance 'HACKED'? Stunt sees insults flash up on screen
text:
The strange messages led people to take to Twitter and question whether ITV - who was broadcasting the BRIT Awards - had been hacked. 
“Has someone hacked the Brits? Random messages during the 1975! #BRITs2017,” wrote one person. 
While a second added: “Has someone actually hacked the tv broadcast of the brits #BRITs2017 this is crazy!” ITV The 1975 perform at the BRIT Awards 2017 ITV One of the slogans that flashed across the screen during the BRIT Awards 2017 We wish we could be down here and watching Michael. We so wish that he could here Dermot O'Leary 
A third added: “What the hells going on here #BRITs2017.” 
However, it appears that the words coming up on the screen were simply part of the performance. 
The 1975 reigned victorious this evening after they were named Best British Group. ITV One of the slogans that flashed across the screen during the BRIT Awards 2017 TWITTER The 1975 have insults flashed up during their performance at the BRIT Awards 2017 Inside the BRIT Awards 2017 Wed, February 22, 2017
